pain_points.title: Knowledge Transfer Complexity
pain_points.description: Spreading framework knowledge to coworkers is difficult when showing raw folder structures without visual context or interactive documentation.
pain_points.quote: I have to spread this knowledge to all my coworkers and just showing dot cloud skills. Folder command folder agents folder rules folder hooks folder et cetera.
pain_points.desired_state: Interactive, visual documentation that allows self-service exploration
pain_points.root_cause: Absence of an interactive documentation platform that bridges the gap between raw framework files and human learning needs
pain_points.impact: Time cost per trainee, cannot scale onboarding, no persistent reference, high adoption barrier

pain_points.title: Lack of Contextual Documentation
pain_points.description: Current framework files lack integrated explanations of purpose, usage examples, and workflow diagrams in a unified view.
pain_points.quote: it has multiple sections explaining the front matter, explaining why and for what is this agent skill or command...showing example how to run what are the options high level workflow diagram
pain_points.current_workaround: Reading individual markdown files without context
pain_points.desired_state: Multi-section view with purpose, examples, options, and diagrams
pain_points.root_cause: Documentation architecture optimized for AI consumption rather than human learning and exploration
pain_points.impact: Steep learning curve, increased misuse, slow discovery of capabilities, reduced user confidence

pain_points.title: Discoverability Challenge
pain_points.description: Without search and tagging, finding relevant skills/commands/agents in a large framework is time-consuming.
pain_points.quote: I want this to have a search page. I want this to have text so I can take skills for myself that are useful

pain_points.title: Organizational Chaos
pain_points.description: Framework components are not visually organized by workflow stage, making it hard to understand which tools apply to which phase.
pain_points.quote: they could be organized visually into stages like we have in discovery, prototyping, implementation and utilities
pain_points.current_workaround: Mental mapping of files to stages

pain_points.title: Lack of Personalization
pain_points.description: Users cannot save their frequently-used commands/skills for quick access.
pain_points.quote: I want it to have like a concept of favorites. So everybody can say add to favorites and we move to favorites
pain_points.current_workaround: Manually remembering or bookmarking file paths

pain_points.title: Developer Friction
pain_points.description: Finding and editing source files requires navigating the file system without clear path references.
pain_points.quote: those agent skills and commands should always have a reference where they are in route. So a given user could copy the pad and go edit the skills
pain_points.desired_state: One-click copy of file paths for editing
